The 200th anniversary of the Grand Canal Some 50 or so boats sailed down the Canal last week, past my apt and docked at the newly constructed jetty beside The Malt House, where ICAN is located. The Grand Canal crosses Leinster from Dublin to the river Shannon in Offaly, with a branch south to the River Barrow. It gives access to some wonderful fishing and ecology and wildlife abound. Worth a trip.

Rathlin 2004 Once upon a time, over 2,000 people from all over Ireland descended onto an island on the northeastern coast of the Island. This Island was nearly 7-8 miles long and less than a mile in length. Folklore has it that people came by boatloads from as far as Mongolia! (yeah man..) And these people partied and partied till their legs turned to jelly and they all became jellyfish... Before they all got transformed..we managed to get a few pictures... Disclaimer: This picture has nothing to do with rathlin. This is in fact Thailand! :) 'Twas mad...the people we met..We actually met 'Jim-Jim'! (Jim-Jim was a code word the lads use for practically anything and imagine our shock when this guy says - People call me Jim-Jim?) Loads of people..I met this Indian girl from London..whose name I can't remember and I wasn't sure if it was her, with us on the bus the next day...Ah well... Also met this guy..who was really big..He was in the shrimping business...His mama cooked shrimp. And her mama before her cooked shrimp,And her mama before her mama cooked shrimp, too. His family knew everything there was to know about the shrimping business.Now, I know everything there is to know about the shrimping business .
